result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM - case called.  Defendant Eric J Haring in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Deputy Tom Tollefson duly sworn.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of the conviction in Price County case No. 01CF61.  Court takes judicial notice.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Deputy Tollefson.  No cross by Defendant.  Argument by Defendant.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Right to counsel.  Defendant has contacted the public defender office.  Information filed with the Court - copy given to Defendant.  Statement by the Court.
Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM - case called.  Defendant Eric J Haring appeared in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - this is not a victim rights case.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court questions Defendant regarding preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
